meanings.definition: In a very loud and noisy way
meanings.sent1: The children laughed uproariously during the noisy parade.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks exploded uproariously in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The clown's antics were so uproariously loud that even the animals in the circus joined in the fun.
meanings.sent4: The thunder roared uproariously, shaking the windows with its noise.
meanings.sent5: The motorcycle engine revved uproariously, drowning out all other sounds.

meanings.definition: In a manner that causes great laughter or amusement
meanings.sent1: The comedian's jokes were so funny that the audience laughed uproariously.
meanings.sent2: The movie had the audience laughing uproariously from start to finish.
meanings.sent3: The puppy chased its tail uproariously, providing entertainment for the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the story made the readers laugh uproariously.
meanings.sent5: The silly dance routine had everyone in the room laughing uproariously.
